title: Training Videos as Guidance for Workshops on Cryo-EM Facilities
content: The Pacific Northwest cryoEM Center (PNCC) was created in 2018 by NIH the Transformative High-Resolution Cryo-electron Microscopy Program (CryoEM) to ensure access and training to high end cryo-electron microscopes [1]. Over the past years PNCC has created hands-on training workshops, as well as remote activities, to train novice users on different aspects of the entire cryo-EM workflow [2]. In order to provide the best experience to trainees coming to PNCC we created a series of videos that were made available to the community via the PNCC YouTube channel [3].
